headline: Inox Clean Energy, RJ Corp acquire Skypower Services, targeting 570MW of African solar PV capacity
summary_80w: Inox Clean Energy has partnered with integrated renewable energy platform RJ Corp to expand into Africa’s renewable energy markets.

headline: India’s 2026-27 budget backs solar supply chain growth, but execution remains key
summary_80w: PV Talk: Charith Konda, energy specialist at IEEFA, says India’s 2026-27 budget aims to “establish a stronger supply chain within the solar and PV cell and module sector,” but warns that “execution is as important as the policy itself.”

headline: Germany contracts 2.4GW of ground-mount solar capacity in 2X oversubscribed auction
summary_80w: Germany’s federal network agency (Bundesnetzagentur) has announced the results of its latest ground-mount solar auction, which closed with bids for more than twice as much capacity as was tendered.

headline: AES Indiana began operations at 250MW solar-plus-storage plant
summary_80w: AES Indiana, a subsidiary of US utility AES Corporation, has started commercial operations at a 250MW solar-plus-storage plant in Pike County, Indiana, US.

headline: US Treasury’s first interim FEOC guidance met with some relief
summary_80w: The US Treasury’s interim Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) guidance is “in line with expectations” according to a US renewable energy supply analyst.

headline: India solar PV additions reach 36.6GW, up 43% YoY – Mercom
summary_80w: Solar PV installations in India have reached a record 36.6GW in 2025, a 43% increase from the previous year’s 25GW.

headline: Belectric to deliver 210MW of solar PV capacity for Severn Trent Green Power in the UK
summary_80w: Belectric, a subsidiary of European energy company the Elevion Group, will deliver EPC services for a 210MW solar PV portfolio in the UK.

headline: ‘Beyond a lithium-only future’: How US trade rules could accelerate BESS diversification
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium hears from Giovanni Damato, President of organic flow battery company CMBlu Energy, Inc., on changes to FEOC and Section 301 tariffs.

headline: EnergyAustralia reaches financial close on 250MWh BESS in South Australia
summary_80w: Major Australian energy generator-retailer EnergyAustralia has reached financial close on its 250MWh Hallett battery energy storage system (BESS) in South Australia.

headline: CleanCo opens 500MWh Tesla Megapack BESS in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: CleanCo Queensland has officially opened the Swanbank BESS, a 250MW/500MWh facility in Ipswich, Australia.

headline: Baltic BESS and TES: Estonia’s 1.1GWh district heating accumulator, Nidec PCS-transformer deal in Lithuania
summary_80w: A 582MWh battery storage project and a gigawatt-hour-scale thermal energy storage system are the latest big developments in the emerging Baltic region, north-eastern Europe.

headline: Grenergy secures financing for 400MW/1.4GWh Central Oasis solar-plus-storage platform in Chile
summary_80w: Spanish independent power producer Grenergy has closed a US$355 million senior non-recourse financing agreement for its Central Oasis solar-plus-storage platform in Chile.

headline: Greenbacker raises US$440 million for 674MW Cider solar project
summary_80w: Greenbacker has raised US$440 million in finance to support the development of the 674MW Cider solar project in the US state of New York.

headline: Malaysia’s largest standalone floating PV project begins construction
summary_80w: Developer EDRA Global Energy, a subsidiary of CGN, has started construction on a 300MW floating PV (FPV) project in Malaysia.

headline: SOLV Energy issues Nasdaq IPO
summary_80w: US solar EPC SOLV Energy has issued its initial public offering (IPO) on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, priced at US$25 per share.

headline: Optimism in European solar rebounds to highest levels seen since May 2025
summary_80w: European solar PV module and component buyers’ sentiment improved significantly in January 2026, according to sun.store's pv.index report.

headline: ‘The cost declines in lithium-ion tech provide very attractive pricing’: ASL on NSW’s recent 12GWh LDES tender
summary_80w: Thimo Mueller of ASL discusses the recent 12GWh LDES tender in New South Wales, Australia, with ESN Premium.

headline: Potentia achieves financial close for ‘Canada’s largest BESS’
summary_80w: Potentia Renewables has successfully closed financing for the Skyview 2 battery energy storage system (BESS) in Edwardsburgh Cardinal, Ontario, Canada.

headline: Yuma County, Arizona: BrightNight breaks ground on 1,200MWh solar-plus-storage project, LRE’s 450MWh BESS now operational
summary_80w: Two BESS projects in Yuma County, Arizona, one from BrightNight, and one from Leeward Renewable Energy, have reached significant milestones.

headline: Hanwha and Morrison’s Chrysalis partner for 3.5GW of solar and storage in North America
summary_80w: A US$30 billion infrastructure giant has just backed a partnership to bring 3.5GW of solar and energy storage to North America.

headline: LG Energy Solution Vertech ‘to deliver 50GWh of US BESS projects in 2026,’ signs Qcells EPC deal
summary_80w: LG ES Vertech, the US-based system integrator subsidiary of LG Energy Solution (LG ES), plans to deliver 50GWh of projects this year, ESN Premium has heard.

headline: Tesla set to launch vehicle-to-grid programme in the US
summary_80w: Tesla is set to officially launch its first vehicle-to-grid (V2G) programme in Texas, US, soon with eyes to expand into California.

headline: MENA poised to become global solar hub, says WoodMac analyst
summary_80w: PV Talk: Wood Mackenzie’s Yana Hryshko argues that MENA is emerging as a solar manufacturing hub, driven, in part, by Chinese partnerships.

headline: National Laboratory of the Rockies lays off 130 employees
summary_80w: The National Laboratory of the Rockies (NLR), previously known as the National Renewable Energy Lab, has laid off 134 employees.

headline: China to add 180-240GW of new solar PV capacity in 2026, down from 315GW in 2025
summary_80w: China expects to add 180-240GW of new solar PV capacity in 2026, according to the latest figures from the CPIA.

headline: MNRE adds 3GW of solar cell capacity to ALMM List-II, reaching 26GW
summary_80w: India’s MNREA has released the fourth revision of its ALMM II for solar cells, increasing the total enlisted manufacturing capacity to 26GW.

headline: EUROPE ROUND-UP: METLEN signs offtake deal in Italy, European Energy to finance Danish solar-plus-storage, TSE acquires French PV projects
summary_80w: A round-up of a number of European project stories from this week, including METLEN, European Energy and TSE.

headline: UK awards 4.9GW solar PV in latest CfD round
summary_80w: The UK government's Allocation round 7a (AR7a) of the Contracts for Difference (CfD) auction has awarded a record 4.9GW of solar PV.

headline: ‘Moment of truth’: The 2026 regulatory agenda for large battery storage in Germany
summary_80w: Germany's BESS market is booming but is still far behind what it is needed for its energy transition. 2026 will be a key year in this regard with several key regulatory questions potentially clarified, writes energy transition comms executive Frederik König.

headline: NineDot Energy closes US$431 million for New York BESS, Ameresco completes multiple tax credit transfers
summary_80w: Energy storage developer NineDot Energy closes US$431 million in construction financing for New York BESS projects. Meanwhile, US energy efficiency and renewables company Ameresco completes multiple tax credit transfer and financing transactions for solar PV and BESS.

headline: Ore Energy pilots 100-hour iron-air BESS at EDF lab in France
summary_80w: Netherlands-based iron-air long-duration energy storage (LDES) startup Ore Energy has completed a grid-connected pilot of its 100-hour iron-air LDES system at EDF Lab les Renardières in France.

headline: BESS financing benefitting from other clean energy segment struggles, US uncertainty, Fidra CEO says
summary_80w: Owner-operator Fidra Energy came out of virtually nowhere to be building one of Europe's largest BESS in the UK, the 1.4GW/3.1GWh Thorpe Marsh project. We catch up with CEO Chris Elder, about its strategy and projects but also broader BESS and clean energy financing trends.

headline: Akaysha Energy submits 1.6GWh BESS to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: Developer Akaysha Energy has submitted a 1.6GWh battery energy storage system (BESS) project to Australia's Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act.

headline: FinDev Canada commits US$56 million loan to 396MW Peruvian solar project, country’s largest
summary_80w: FinDev Canada has announced a US$56 million loan to support the development of project Illa, which will be the largest in Peru.

headline: Australia: Victoria government accelerates 700MW of battery storage via Development Facilitation Program
summary_80w: The Victoria government has approved two large-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) projects totalling 700MW through its Development Facilitation Program (DFP).

headline: Carlyle-backed Revera Energy bags US$150 million to accelerate renewables pipeline in the UK and Australia
summary_80w: Energy platform Revera Energy has completed an expanded US$150 million credit facility for its UK and Australian portfolio.

headline: ACME, Ceigall secure 220MW solar-plus-storage contracts in Madhya Pradesh
summary_80w: Rewa Ultra Mega Solar Limited (RUMSL) has extended a Letter of Award (LOA) to Ceigall India and ACME Solar to develop 220MW solar-plus-storage in Morena, Madhya Pradesh.

headline: Inside European solar: Strong fundamentals, global opportunities and grid challenges
summary_80w: Market dynamics and growing concerns over Europe’s grid bottlenecks were key topics at this year’s Solar Finance & Investment Europe summit.

headline: Boviet Solar ‘committed’ to US manufacturing despite Chinese ownership uncertainty
summary_80w: Boviet Solar has affirmed its commitment to US solar PV manufacturing despite plans by its parent company to divest its ownership.

headline: Western Australia’s 70GW renewables hub advances with Chinese and South Korean feasibility partnership
summary_80w: WGEH has signed a Feasibility Phase Agreement to advance Stage 1 development of its 70GW renewable energy project in Western Australia.

headline: Energy Vault to secure 1.5GWh of US-manufactured sodium-ion BESS from Peak Energy
summary_80w: Energy storage developer and system integrator Energy Vault and sodium-ion battery energy storage system (BESS) startup Peak Energy have announced a 1.5GWh strategic development agreement.

headline: Samsung SDI partners with Korea East-West Power to develop ‘global’ BESS projects
summary_80w: South Korean battery and electronics materials manufacturer Samsung SDI and South Korean state-utility Korea East-West Power (EWP) have signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to develop and invest in global energy storage systems (ESS) and renewable energy projects.

headline: RWE, Masdar, Zenobe, Enlight and others forge partnerships, tolling offers to further Germany market expansion
summary_80w: A busy week of grid-scale BESS project news from Germany, with numerous development, project, optimisation and tolling partnerships announced.

headline: Sungrow to invest US$270 million in inverter and BESS factory in Poland, first outside Asia
summary_80w: Chinese-based OEM Sungrow will build a PV inverter and battery storage manufacturing facility in southwest Poland, its first outside Asia.

headline: A123, Hithium tout semi-solid cells, immersion cooling and LSFT BESS safety advances
summary_80w: With battery storage safety under increasing scrutiny, Wanxiang A123 Systems and Hithium have unveiled new products and large-scale fire testing (LSFT), respectively.

headline: CATL, Cornex, SolaX and other Chinese energy storage players in multi-GWh international agreements
summary_80w: Carrie Xiao examines some notable recent partnerships and supply agreements for Chinese energy storage players in the Middle East, Europe, Africa and Australia.

headline: Revera Energy secures US$150 million to support 3.4GWh of battery storage across Australia and the UK
summary_80w: Energy infrastructure platform Revera Energy has completed an expanded US$150 million credit facility to accelerate development and construction of its battery storage, solar, and green hydrogen project pipeline across Australia and the UK.

headline: Solar Energy UK expects lower solar strike price in forthcoming UK renewables auction result
summary_80w: Strike prices for solar PV in upcoming UK Contracts for Difference (CfD) allocation have been forecast to be around £63-68MWh (US$86-93MWh), according to trade body, Solar Energy UK (SEUK).

headline: Australia’s largest operational BESS: Synergy completes CATL-powered 2,400MWh Collie Battery
summary_80w: State-owned energy company Synergy has completed the 500MW/2,400MWh Collie Battery Energy Storage System (CBESS) in Western Australia, establishing Collie as home to Australia's largest operational battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: US federal government drops appeal in retroactive solar tariff case
summary_80w: The US federal government has withdrawn its appeal against a US Court of International Trade (CIT) ruling to retroactively collect two years of tariffs on imported solar panels.

headline: EIB urges funding for EU solar inverters amid cybersecurity fears
summary_80w: The European Investment Bank (EIB) is planning to provide dedicated support to European solar inverter manufacturers amid a call for greater energy security and strategic autonomy.

headline: United Solar inaugurates 40GW polysilicon plant in Oman
summary_80w: Solar manufacturer United Solar has launched a polysilicon manufacturing facility in Oman, adding 100,000 metric tons of annual production capacity.

headline: Electricity demand to grow rapidly in ‘new era’ for energy, says IEA
summary_80w: Global electricity demand is set to grow 2.5 times as fast as overall energy demand by 2030, ushering in what the International Energy Agency (IEA) has dubbed the “Age of Electricity”.

headline: EU Commission approves €3 billion German clean energy manufacturing scheme
summary_80w: The European Commission has approved a €3 billion (US$3.55 billion) clean energy manufacturing aid scheme from Germany.

headline: GridStor warns of industry slowdown as US Treasury guidance delays BESS decisions
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks to Daniel Dedrick, US-based BESS developer and operator, GridStor's CTO, about the company’s strategies for navigating FEOC and Section 301 tariffs.

headline: FlexGen begins operating 700MWh total BESS in Wisconsin, Iowa for Alliant Energy
summary_80w: Software-focused battery energy storage system (BESS) integrator FlexGen has put two utility-scale BESS projects in operation in Wisconsin and Iowa, US, totalling 700MWh.

headline: Europe’s energy storage buildout: who leads and who is left behind
summary_80w: Europe’s energy storage market has hit a turning point. What was once a scattered, early-phase market featuring pilot projects and daring developers has swiftly evolved into a dynamic, capital-intensive infrastructure sector, writes Wood Mackenzie research associate Cecilie Kristiansen.

headline: EVE Energy to deploy 628Ah battery cells in solar-plus-storage system at Kuala Lumpur International Airport
summary_80w: Chinese battery manufacturer EVE Energy has secured a contract with the Malaysian government to deploy an AC/DC integrated 36MWh solar-plus-storage system at Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA).

headline: KKR commits AU$603 million to HMC Capital’s 5.7GW Australian energy storage and wind pipeline
summary_80w: Global investment firm KKR has announced a strategic partnership with HMC Capital, committing up to AU$603 million (US$423 million) to HMC's Energy Transition Platform as Australia accelerates its renewable energy deployment and grid modernisation efforts.

headline: Australia’s energy transition puts essential system services in focus
summary_80w: Sam Markham of Fluence Australia believes grid-forming BESS are essential to deliver a safe, secure and affordable decarbonised power system.

headline: Sungrow to open PV inverter, ESS manufacturing plant in Poland
summary_80w: Chinese solar PV inverter and energy storage manufacturer Sungrow has expanded its manufacturing outreach with a new facility in southwestern Poland.

headline: Aiko buys licenses to Maxeon BC solar patents
summary_80w: Chinese solar PV manufacturer Aiko Solar will license a raft of solar cell technology patents from Singapore-based manufacturer Maxeon.

headline: Grenergy powers fourth phase of solar-plus-storage Oasis de Atacama project
summary_80w: Spanish independent power producer (IPP) has energised the fourth phase of its flagship solar-plus-storage project in Chile, Oasis de Atacama.

headline: Green Genius commissions 120.8MW solar project in Latvia
summary_80w: Lithuanian independent power producer (IPP) Green Genius has commenced operations of its 120.8MW solar project in Jekabpils region, Latvia.

headline: GameChange wins 1.2GW Saudi tracker order
summary_80w: GameChange Solar is to supply its Genius trackers for the 1.2GW Bisha Solar PV Independent Power Plant in Saudi Arabia.

headline: Australia launches formal investigation into solar waste management
summary_80w: The Australian government has launched a formal inquiry into the reuse and recycling of solar modules across the country.

headline: Lunar Energy raises US$232 million to scale VPP software globally
summary_80w: Home battery storage and virtual power plant (VPP) specialist Lunar Energy has raised US$102 million in an oversubscribed Series D financing round led by B Capital and Prelude Ventures.

headline: E-Storage, Sunraycer enter agreements for Texas BESS projects totalling 503MWh
summary_80w: E-Storage, Canadian Solar's energy storage subsidiary and owner and operator Sunraycer Renewables have entered into agreements for the supply and long-term servicing of two battery energy storage systems (BESS) in Franklin County, Texas, US.

headline: Battery data analytics software specialist TWAICE nets European Investment Bank funding
summary_80w: The European Investment Bank (EIB) has invested €24 million (US$28 million) in cloud-based battery data analytics provider TWAICE.

headline: Iberdrola Australia opens 130MWh battery storage system in western Sydney
summary_80w: Iberdrola Australia has officially opened its 65MW/130MWh Smithfield BESS in western Sydney, New South Wales, ahead of schedule.

headline: ‘We’re not stopping here’: Reactions as Australia’s New South Wales smashes long-duration storage targets with 12GWh tender
summary_80w: NSW concludes Australia's largest LDES tender, awarding six battery projects 12GWh. Industry calls it "game-changer" for grid reliability.

headline: Australia’s New South Wales designates 22GWh of pumped hydro as critical infrastructure
summary_80w: The NSW government has declared two pumped hydro projects totalling 22,000MWh of storage capacity as critical infrastructure.

headline: GSC: Africa adds record 4.5GW of new solar PV capacity in 2025
summary_80w: Figures from the Global Solar Council (GSC) suggest that Africa added 4.5GW of new solar PV capacity in 2025.

headline: Sunwafe selects Tresca to build its 20GW ingot/wafer manufacturing facility in Spain
summary_80w: Sunwafe has selected Spanish engineering firm Tresca Ingenieria for the development of its 20GW ingot/wafer manufacturing facility in Spain.

headline: IRENA: Vietnam is cheapest country for domestic solar production
summary_80w: Vietnam is the cheapest country to produce fully domestic solar modules outside of China, according to a report from the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA).

headline: Drone-based cleaning agent released for agrivoltaic systems
summary_80w: Portuguese PV cleaning specialist Chemitek Solar has launched a new solution for drone-based cleaning of agrivoltaic systems.

headline: Turkey, Saudi Arabia sign 5GW renewables development agreement, 2GW solar PV in phase one
summary_80w: The governments of Turkey and Saudi Arabia have signed a 5GW renewables agreement to develop power plants in the former country.

headline: What are the latest issues with TOPCon solar panels?
summary_80w: Explainer: Two new studies offer fresh insights into the performance of TOPCon solar modules, including a new degradation mode related to encapsulants.

headline: 26GW Australian Renewable Energy Hub secures AU$21 million ARENA boost for Pilbara green hydrogen push
summary_80w: The 26GW Australian Renewable Energy Hub (AREH) in Western Australia has secured AU$21 million (US$14.71 million) in funding from the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) to advance large-scale hydrogen production capabilities that will support green iron manufacturing in the Pilbara region.

headline: ‘Reversible solid oxide fuel cells’: Noon Energy’s approach to 100+ hour energy storage
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Noon Energy co-founder and CEO Chris Graves about the company’s approach to long-duration energy storage.

headline: Aypa Power closes US$1.5 billion credit facility for US BESS projects
summary_80w: Energy storage developer-operator Aypa Power has closed a US$1.5 billion construction warehouse revolving credit facility to advance projects across the US.

headline: ‘Most TSOs are sitting on their hands’ when it comes to energy storage, says Nordic developer
summary_80w: That was the view of Søren Juel Hansen, energy storage director at Nordic Solar, when asked by Energy-Storage.news about the role of transmission system operators (TSO) in the industry.

headline: Fluence revenue up 154% but margin halves in last three months of 2025
summary_80w: System integrator Fluence saw revenue of US$475.2 million in the last quarter of 2025, while its net loss grew around 10% to US$62.6 million.

headline: Philippines House of Representatives passes national energy storage framework legislation
summary_80w: A framework for the “development, utilisation and commercialisation of energy storage systems” in the Philippines has been passed by the House of Representatives.

headline: 437MWh BESS in Australia’s highest city receives final approvals ahead of commissioning
summary_80w: Valent Energy has received development approval from the New South Wales government and satisfied AEMO grid compliance requirements under clause 5.3.4a for its 150MW/437MWh Armidale Battery Energy Storage System (BESS).

headline: Octopus Australia acquires 4.8GWh battery storage project in New South Wales
summary_80w: Octopus Australia has announced plans to develop what it claims is Australia's “largest planned battery energy storage system (BESS)” in New South Wales.

headline: Australia’s biggest LDES tender: NSW contracts six battery storage projects totalling 1.17GW/12GWh
summary_80w: ASL (formerly AEMO Services) has completed New South Wales' (NSW) largest-ever tender for long-duration energy storage (LDES), contracting six new battery projects for a combined 1.17GW/11.98GWh.

headline: Enphase to cut 160 jobs globally, as Q4 microinverter shipments drop to 682MW
summary_80w: Microinverter supplier Enphase Energy has filed an 8-K form with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) stating that it will reduce its workforce globally by nearly 160 jobs.

headline: Hybridise or die: Solar and storage valuations under pressure
summary_80w: Industry leaders warn that hybridising PV with batteries is now essential to secure revenue, manage volatility, and maintain investor value.

headline: Cost the key consideration in European supply chains as reliance on China remains
summary_80w: In the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, European energy has gone from an overreliance on Russia to an overreliance on China.

headline: ‘Different production profiles with one grid connection’: solutions to Europe’s grid capacity crunch
summary_80w: Optimising existing grid capacity could be the most viable solution to Europe’s long-standing grid capacity challenges.

headline: Avangrid commissions 269MW solar PV in Oregon
summary_80w: Avangrid, a subsidiary of Spanish utility Iberdrola, has reached commercial operations at two PV power plants in the US state of Oregon.

headline: Zelestra inks 176MW Texas solar PV PPA with Meta, 50MW in Ohio with AEPEP
summary_80w: Spanish renewable energy company Zelestra has finalised a power purchase agreement with Facebook’s parent company Meta for its 176MW Skull Creek Solar Plant in Texas.

headline: US defends IRA domestic content bonus after China scores WTO win
summary_80w: US authorities have hit back at a WTO ruling that subsidies for domestically produced solar and other clean energy components discriminate against Chinese firms.

headline: Evecon, Mirova and Corsica Sole inaugurate first of two 100MW/200MWh BESS in Estonia
summary_80w: A 100MW/200MWh BESS project in Estonia has been inaugurated by Baltic Storage Platform (BSP), a joint venture (JV) between Baltic developer Evecon, French independent power producer (IPP) Corsica Sole and investment manager Mirova.

headline: Energy storage players Great Power, Sunwoda and Deye Technology file Hong Kong listing applications
summary_80w: Three Chinese energy storage companies have recently successively filed or updated their listing applications with the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX), planning IPOs on the Hong Kong Main Board.

headline: Standalone solar no longer enough in Europe as storage takes centre stage
summary_80w: “Standalone solar is not dead, but it is challenging,” said Pierre Bartholin, head of power hedging at investor Nuveen Infrastructure, opening the debate at Solar Media’s Solar Finance Investment Europe (SFIE) conference in London on the future of co-located battery storage.

headline: Enlight advances US$3 billion, 1.2GW solar 4GWh BESS ‘Complex’ in Arizona
summary_80w: IPP Enlight Renewable Energy has reached development milestones for its total 1.21GW solar plus 4GWh energy storage CO Bar Complex in Arizona, US, and is now advancing the project toward operation.

headline: LG Energy Solution targets 90GWh of battery orders in US energy storage market in 2026
summary_80w: LG Energy Solution will keep global battery cell production at around 300GWh in 2026, while increasing its proportion of supply for energy storage system (ESS) applications.

headline: Why the best way to avoid BESS commissioning delays is to start earlier than you might expect
summary_80w: Commissioning is often an underestimated final step in the hard work it takes to bring a BESS project online, writes Lynn Appollis-Laurent of Camelot Energy.
